page.title: 01General Review of S.Clifton
page.content: The predominant feature of our D block is of a rural nature consisting of three centres of population.The main one is the village of South Clifton.To the east of the block is the hamlet of Spalford and to the west is High and Loe Marnham.The block is almost divided in half by the River Trent which flows from south to north.On the west bank stands Marnham Power station. To the east of the block runs the main Newark to Gainsborough Road the A1133.From east to west in the northren part of the block runs the disused railway line which once connected Lincoln with the East Midlands Coalfield.An impressive viaduct still spans the Trent.West of the Trent the railway is still used to carry coal to the power station.
